Workshop to train school bus drivers hel.description: RANCHI: The transport department in collaboration with Society of Indian Automobile Manufacturers organised a workshop to train and sensitise drivers and attendants operating buses of city-based schools. Around 50 school bus drivers participated in the day-long event held at the district transport office here on Friday. The programme focused on educating the drivers and attendants about safety parameters. Apart from that, the participants were also given an account of school transportation guidelines issued by the Central Board of Secondary Education. The day-long training was conducted by Ankur Mathur, who primarily zeroed in on blind spot detection, lane driving, road signage familiarisation and turning rules. "School bus drivers usually have lot of experience, but most of them lack adequate knowledge of traffic rules and that is why they need to update themselves. Before conducting the training, we tested their knowledge of traffic rules and found that only 20% were aware of the guidelines. However, most scored between 70-80% after attending the workshop," Mathur said. The drivers and attendants were also issued certificates after completion of the training programme. A few drivers raised the issue of time management, which they face on a daily basis. "I have been driving school bus for the last 12 years and have witnessed the change in city traffic. Ten years ago, it was easier to get back to school in time after dropping kids, but with the rampant growth of traffic it has become a herculean task. If we miss the deadline, we are taken to task by the school management. How can a driver concentrate on safety parameters when he is under pressure to conform to school timings," a driver working with a reputed CBSE school in capital city said. When contacted, the joint transport commissioner of road safety, Ravishankar Vidyarthi, said that the programme was organised in order to make roads safe for school kids. Vidyarthi also took cognizance of the issues raised by drivers and said: "The concerns raised by the drivers are valid and I will look into the problems." After last Friday namaz before Eid, shop.description: RANCHI: With 'Alvida Jumma' - the final Friday of the holy month of Ramzan - over, preparations for Eid-ul-Fitr are now in full swing in the city markets. From delicious food items to skullcaps, the markets put up all festive items for sale. After the iftar, the street-side markets on the stretch between Kali Mandir Chowk and Iqra Masjid was abuzz with activity as shoppers came out in large numbers. The traffic on this route has already been diverted. Sale of the staple food during Ramzan - dry fruits - has taken quite a hit this year due to the scorching heat. Instead of buying cashews and raisins, people for watermelons, mangoes and other seasonal fruits, the shopkeepers said. "This year, Ramzan will be observed in the peak of summer and hence, the shoppers prefer hydrating food items. Dates, especially from Saudi Arabia, are in great demand as it is nourishing and doesn't raise the body temperature. People are also including fresh fruits in their iftar platter," said Md Ashfaque, a shopkeeper who has been setting up his stall of dry fruits at the market for the past decade. The Bakar Khani or sweetbread is yet another item that is selling in large numbers. Bakers, who sell freshly made Bakar Khani, have been in the business for decades. Fifty-year-old Firoz, who sells freshly made and fragrant Bakar Khani from his tiny shop-cum-bakery at the stretch between Ratan Talkies Chowk and Karbala Chowk, has been making the delicacy since he was a young boy. "We work odd jobs around the year, but during Ramzaan, selling Bakar Khani has been a family business for many years now. We begin preparations at 6 am in the morning and the first batch is ready and packaged for sale by the noon. They are priced anything between Rs 10 and Rs 80 a piece, depending on the size and also the ingredients." Many shops have also stocked up imported 'Itars', with the pricier varieties pegged at Rs 1,000 for a bottle - both in edible and daily use varieties for the festival. Life thrown out of gear as sudden storm.description: RANCHI: Life in Ranchi was thrown out of gear on Monday evening as heavy rain lashed the city for an hour resulting in inundation of low lying areas and bringing the traffic to a standstill after trees were uprooted at several places. The rain, however, provided the citizens with a much-needed relief from the scorching heat. After the rain, the mercury plummeted by around five degrees to 34.6° Ceslius. Within the hour-long rainfall, the city received 22 mm and several areas of Azad Basti, Karbala Chowk, Pathalkudwa, AG More and parts of Kutchery Road faced waterlogging. Traffic also came to a standstill as several trees were uprooted by a strong gust of wind and led to long traffic snarls on major arterial roads. Uprooted trees were seen near Roshpa Tower on Main Road, Kantatoli Chowk, AG More. A tree also fell on an ambulance which was parked near K C Roy memorial hospital in Lalpur, damaging the vehicle. Electricity supply was affected in various areas as a pole fell down near the residence of the SP (city). The electricity department has started clearing the debris and are fixing faults to restore the supply at the earliest. No injuries and casualties were reported till evening. Soon after the thunderstorms, Ranchi Municipal Corporation deployed several teams to clear the debris and normal traffic was restored by 7 pm. "All uprooted trees have been cleared and there was no report of any injury or casualty," said RMC city manager Sandeep Kumar, . India Metrological Department (IMD) Ranchi centre director S D Kotal said the rain is the effect of the onset of monsoon and south westerly winds which passed through the state on the way to Bay of Bengal. "Several districts of the state, including Ranchi, will experience similar weather for the next five days with rain and thunderstorm," Kotal said. Teacher accuses Hussainabad MLA of haras.description: PALAMU/RANCHI: The state commission for women (JSCW) asked Palamu police to provide security to a woman who on Tuesday accused Hussainabad MLA Kushwaha Shivpujan Mehta and four others of making sexual advances and causing mental harassment to her. The complainant is an assistant teacher at a government middle school in Palamu’s Medininagar. The lawmaker has denied the charges. Palamu SP Indrajeet Mahatha said he has received a request from JSCW for arranging security for the teacher. “Adequate security will be provided to her,” he added. On Tuesday, the teacher submitted a three-page complaint letter to the JSCW, Ranchi, saying Rajeshwar Mehta, the principal of government middle school in Hussainabad where she was posted in 2018, had made sexual advances towards her at the behest of the MLA. In her complaint, the teacher said she was put through mental harassment after she declined Rajeshwar’s advances. “When I applied for a transfer, assistant clerk Mahendra Singh sought bribe for getting the job done. I was defamed and humiliated repeatedly, which in turn has made me mentally ill and threw my life out of gear,” the complainant said in her letter. The complainant, who was posted briefly at the district library, is presently posted at middle school in Pokhraha Khurd in Medininagar. Shivpujan, a BSP MLA, rubbished the allegations and said he was being framed by a few local politicians and officials of the district education department. “I have never met the teacher. I do not even know her,” he told TOI. JSCW chairperson Kalyani Sharan said an enquiry will be conducted as per the commission’s protocol. “The MLA and the other accused will also be called to explain their stand,” Sharan said on Wednesday. Shivpujan is the second incumbent MLA of the state in the middle of a sex slur after JVM-P’s Pradeep Yadav. Ahead of the Lok Sabha election, Yadav was accused of molesting a woman functionary of his party in a hotel room. A lower court dismissed Yadav’s anticipatory bail plea on Tuesday. \nManan Vidya Manrakhan Mahto School cel.description: Music, rhythm and dance set the evening rolling for the celebration of the fifth annual day of Manan Vidya Manrakhan Mahto School, last week. Shipra impressed with her performance during a dance-drama based on Tagore’s 'Chandalika'.  Students put up a variety of acts, dancing to the tunes of eastern, western and folk songs. Ritika and Shrishti matched steps to the tunes of Mera desh rangeela, while tiny tots rocked the stage on Cockroaz’s signature tune. “It’s like watching trained actors perform on stage. My friends have presented a wonderful show,” an enthusiastic Mani said. Toppers were felicitated as Principal Jayalakshmi S presented the school’s progress report. Chief guest MJ Xavier, who is the director of IIM-Ranchi, presented the awards. “I loved the performance put up by the school orchestra,” said Sidharth, a music-lover.Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

Jharkhand: Call for ballot paper polls g.description: RANCHI: Blaming their humiliating rout in the recently concluded general elections to EVMs, opposition parties in the state have begun a campaign for return to ballot papers in the upcoming assembly polls. While the Left parties have time and again questioned the authenticity of EVMs, regional parties of Jharkhand, which are currently confronting existential crisis, have also echoed similar concerns. Two weeks ago, JVM-P led by former chief minister Babulal Marandi voiced in favour of ballot papers. On Sunday, Jharkhand Mukti Morcha (JMM), the principal opposition party in the state, also resolved to press for use of ballot of papers during its recent central committee meeting. JMM working president Hemant Soren said, "The authenticity of the Election Commission and the polls have increasingly come under question. In such a situation, we demand that all elections henceforth, including the upcoming assembly elections, be done on ballot papers." On the 2019 Lok Sabha polls verdict, Soren said, "The results makes us raise more questions on EVMs. Just sometime back, someone was telling me about a news report in a national magazine which did an RTI-based story highlighting how 20,000 EVMs went missing. Moreover, after every big occasion, say a big festival, there is often a great enthusiasm among public for days. But after the our election festival, I couldn't sense any happiness among the masses." RJD - another constituent of the opposition's mahagatbandhan during general elections in the state, echoed similar sentiments. RJD's state president Abhay Singh said they will submit a fresh memorandum to the EC demanding use of ballot papers. "Jharkhand is a small state. Why not experiment with ballot paper this time in assembly polls? This will give a clear idea between authenticity of EVMs and ballot papers," he said, adding that RJD has long been demanding this. Congress, the grand old party and another key constituent of the grand alliance, however, towed a different line. "Our stand is simple. Rather than blaming EVMs, it's time everyone works on the ground to make an impact in the election," a senior Congress leader and party spokesperson Alok Dubey said. Meanwhile, BJP isn't surprised with the ballot chorus. "EVM is good when results are in favour, but bad when you lose. That's the hypocrisy of parties which prefer doing opportunistic politics. BJP believes in development-based politics and sanctity of constitutional bodies," party spokesperson Pratul Shahdeo said. Taking a dig on JMM, he said, "Why don't their MP from Rajmahal resign, if they are not in favour of EVMs." Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

Steel City bike gangs target senior citi.description: Loot and snatching have become common in the Steel City with goons targeting the senior citizens and women with impunity. Recently, septuagenarian Namita Chatterjee was taking an evening walk in front of her house in Sonari when three bike-borne goons came from behind and snatched her chain. Chatterjee fell when the pushed her and broke her arm. Neighbours took the bleeding old lady to TMH. Namita had to be operated upon and was confined to bed for nearly four months. She refused to lodge a complaint with the police. Similarly, Manju Kar, who is in her sixties and also lives in Sonari, was targeted by bike-borne snatchers near her home. Manju talking to TOI narrated how she was stopped by the goons and her chain was snatched. Manju's daughter Chaitali Kar, who lives in Australia with her family and had come down to her ancestral house with her children, too fell victims of this snatching gang. She was attacked near busy Kagalnagar market area. Chaitali said goons came on a bike and snatched her purse. Chaitali had to approach the police to lodge a complaint, as she lost her debit cards and mobile phone. Another woman was robbed of her ornaments in Sonari on knife-point, when she was out on the road in the early hours to get milk from the booth. Due to the shrinking job market, many youths from the Steel City are moving to other places leaving behind their old parents. Taking advantage of this situation goons are now target senior citizens and women. Though these types of attacks were common in most parts of the city, a study revealed that most of the chain snatching and house loot incidents are taking place in areas under Sonari and Kadma police stations, which are under Jamshedpur West assembly segment. When BJP MLA saryu Rai, the local lawmaker, was contacted, he said CM Raghubar Das is the home minister too, and he should pay attention to this problem. City SP Prabhat Kumar, instead of going into the details of the problem and having sympathy for senior citizens, tried to gauge the gravity of the situation by records. He said those incidents which are not reported to police are “no incidents”. Meanwhile, residents of the affected area said Sonari police station office incharge is not cooperative and is always reluctant to register cases terming them to be petty crimes. During Raghubar's recent visit, the CM came down heavily on the city SP at the Sonari aero-drome over the rise in crime graph in the Steel City. Residents allege that Tiger Mobiles (police on bikes) and PCR vans patrolling in the city area are of no use. “They are more interested getting bribes from builders, engaged in illegal construction in Tata Steel lease area, rather than giving security to the common man,” said Manoj Singh, an ex-officer of Tata Steel. Former state minister from Congress Banna Gupta too echoed similar sentiments and came down heavily on the poice administration for not able to give protection to women and senior citizens. Gupta too said police are more interested in making money than giving security, which is their prime job. Though he did not want to name to corrupt officers, he said a section of the cops are hands in glove with the illegal matka, gambling den operators. He said crime in city can not be controlled unless illegal bars, gambling and drug dens are uprooted with an iron hand. Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

Urmila Matondkar.description: MUMBAI: The Congress on Friday nominated actress Urmila Matondkar and former Lok Sabha speaker Meira Kumar from Mumbai North and Bihar's Sasaram parliamentary constituencies respectively. The party renominated its sitting MP Ranjet Ranjan from Supaul in Bihar, as it released a list of another 12 candidates for the general elections. With this list, the Congress has so far nominated 305 Lok Sabha candidates. Urmila Matondkar to contest from Mumbai North parliamentary constituency on a Congress ticket.… https://t.co/JweKWNh1FN— ANI (@ANI) 1553836382000It also changed its candidate in Uttar Pradesh's Maharajganj by now fielding Supriya Shrinate in place of Tanushree Tripathi, the daughter of jailed politician Amarmani Tripathi, after facing widespread criticism. "The Congress central election committee has approved the candidature of Urmila Matondkar as party candidate to contest the ensuing general elections from Mumbai North parliamentary constituency in Maharashtra," a party statement said. Matondkar had joined the Congress after meeting Rahul Gandhi on Wednesday and had later said that she was "here to stay". Meira Kumar have been contesting from her Sasaram parliamentary constituency for many years but had lost in the 2014 Lok Sabha polls. Apart from Supriya Shrinate, in the list of 12 candidates released by the party, four are from Bihar and seven from Odisha. The Congress also released a list of 20 candidates for Odisha Assembly election. Mamata Banerjee.description: VISAKHAPATNAM: Projecting TDP supremo and AP chief minister N Chandrababu Naidu as a “national leader of importance” and keeping the debate on the alternate front prospects in the ensuing elections alive, West Bengal chief minister and Trinamool Congress chief Mamata Banerjee appealed to people of AP to elect TDP again to keep the duo of Narendra Modi and Amit Shah away from power. “Who is Modi to ask about our Prime Minister candidate? We will decide who to elect our leader as there will be alternative for Modi,” she pointed out. Mamata said Naidu has done a lot for development of Andhra Pradesh. “It’s a necessity for AP people to give the power to Naidu again as he will play a key role in national politics and show a path of development to the entire country,” she added. Addressing a public meeting convened by TDP on Sunday, Mamata said Naidu is the leader to take the country forward. “Like he has done in Andhra Pradesh, Naidu can do a lot in Delhi,” she said. Coming down heavily on Modi, Mamata appealed the gathering to save the country and remove Modi (desh ko bachana hai to Modi ko hatao). “Modi claimed to be chaiwala after 2014 elections. Now he says he is chowkidar,” she added. “But chowkidar for whom? For those who looted the country. Modi had claimed that demonitisation would mitigate terrorism and stop black money, but ironically the number of terrorist attacks was the highest in the past two years. Under Modi’s regime, more number of farmers committed suicide and unemployment increased.” She added that Modi failed to explain the Pulawama incident and the Rafale deal and spurned the demand for an all-party meeting on the issues. “The nation does not want leaders like Narendra Modi and Amit Shah,” she asserted, and challenged Modi for an open debate on a national channel of his choice to discuss issues facing the country. Imam gets life in jail for raping minor.description: BOKARO/RANCHI: In two separate incidents, an Imam was sentenced to life imprisonment for raping a minor girl while another man was awarded seven years in prison for raping a woman in two different parts of the state. In the first case, the court of special Pocso judge, Justice Ramesh Chandra, on Thursday sentenced Zakir Hussain (40) to life imprisonment and imposed a fine of Rs 50,000 on him for raping a Class VIII girl. Hussain was the Imam of the madrassa where the girl studied. The court held him guilty under section 4 and 6 of POCSO Act. The case against Zakir was registered at Bengabad police station in Giridih on September 1, 2017. The complainant had alleged that he raped her four times at madrassa while claiming he loved her. Additional public prosecutor, Ajay Kumar, said the convict is already married. He said, “The court awarded life imprisonment to and slapped Rs 50,000 fine on Hussain for outraging modesty of a minor girl.” In the second incident, a local court in Ranchi sentenced a man to seven years in jail for raping a woman under Khalari police station area of Ranchi district. A fine of Rs 20,000 was also slapped on the convict with the provision that he would undergo additional imprisonment of six months for default in payment. “Additional judicial commissioner S K Pandey sentenced the convict, Ajay Kumar Ekka, after finding him guilty under Section 376 (rape) of the IPC,” additional public prosecutor A K Ray said. In her FIR lodged with Khalari police station in June 2017, the survivor said Ekka had sexually exploited her on the pretext of marrying her after getting a job. She alleged the convict had also taken Rs 3 lakh from her. Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

\nThree-day food festival organized by s.description: The three-day food festival, orgainzed by students of BIT Mesra Hotel Management, got underway on Thursday. This year’s theme was Awadhi cuisine. “We wanted to stress on rich traditional Indian cuisine this year, and thus chose famed Awadhi food as our theme,” said Gautam Shandilya, professor of hotel management. The students tried their best to emulate Awadhi mahaul, from decorating the place with model cannons to wearing traditional kurtas and topis to using Lakhnawi tallafuz in their language. “We tried to make the setting look as authentic as possible and took help from friends who are from that region to brush up our language,” said Satyendra Ojha, a student. Students were seen enjoying both the vegetarian and non-vegetarian fare platters. But it was the Kebab and Paneer Tikka that were hits. “These are most delicious kebabs I have ever had,” Prasanth was heard complimenting Chandan, who was manning the stall. Among the vegetarians, Shahi Tukda and Sevaiyyan were major hits. The evening also saw cultural activities. Shambo Chatterjee’s rendition of Beete lamhe got him quite a fan following. Ahead of monsoon, city turns into garbag.description: RANCHI: The garbage collection system in Ranchi seems to have completely collapsed in the past one week as piles of wastes were seen littered across the city. Ahead of the monsoon, such garbage piles pose potential threats, including waterlogging and outbreak of diseases. The garbage piles were seen in both residential and commercial areas with wastes overflowing from bins. A quick recce of the city's showed even posh places like Kanke Road, Morhabad, Circular Road and Bariatu Road among others are also not only spared but have become the worst-affected places. Divyanshu, a resident of Rose Valley apartment in Rameshwaram Lane in Bariatu, rued that the garbage collection has stopped for at least a week now and narrated how foul smell and mosquito problems have made life difficult for people in the locality. He said, "No one has turned up for cleaning since the last one week forcing us to live with the stink. Flies and mosquitoes can be seen everywhere. We aren't able to open windows even during daytime due to the stink." Kanke Road residents, too, echoed the same. "As I go out to Morhabadi for morning walk daily, I find scores of unattended garbage at seven to eight points. They are overflowing from the bins everyday," said Akash Rajgarhia, a resident of Vasant Vihar in Kanke road. Ahead of the monsoon, the residents fear that such apathy by the authorities concerned would lead to health hazards. An associate professor of the medicine department at Rims, Dr D K Jha, said such accumulation of domestic garbage acts as catalyst for all kinds of microorganism that can infect any healthy body. He said, "There are high chances of spreading of diseases like malaria, dengue and typhoid due to garbage heaps. Moreover, people can also get gastro infections due to the unhygienic environment." The Ranchi Municipal Corporation (RMC), which is responsible for upkeep of the city, said 800 workers of Essel Infra had gone on a strike over payment of wages but promised things will improve soon. "We have sorted out the cleanliness worker issues and they have started returning to work starting Saturday. We are deploying 200 pick-up trucks and JCBs in three shifts to clear the garbage," said RMC's city manager Sandeep Kumar. Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

PM Modi.description: JEYPORE: Prime Minister Narendra Modi on Friday said his government had taken measures to set up a 'chowkidar' in space and asked people to vote for a government that can take concrete decisions and not just raise slogans. Launching his campaign in eastern India with a rally in Jeypore area of Odisha's Koraput district, the prime minister said the NDA government wouldn't have been able to do any development work in the country without the support of the people. He sought blessings from his supporters for the 2019 Lok Sabha elections and asserted that the NDA government has left no stone unturned to bring about development in the state. Land, air or space, we had courage to do surgical strikes: PM Modi"The NDA government has been working hard to develop road and rail infrastructure in the state. There is no dearth of funds when it comes to development work in the country. "In the last five years, the government has been able to build homes for eight lakh families, light up 3,000 houses and provide gas connections to 40 lakh homes," Modi stated. Referring to Mission Shakti, when India demonstrated anti-satellite (ASAT) missile capability by shooting down a live satellite, he said the government has taken measures to set up a 'chowkidar' (watchman) in space. He came down heavily on opposition parties who he said "belittled" the space achievement. "Those that are criticising the anti-satellite technology will be given a befitting reply in the elections," he claimed, urging people to vote for a government that can take concrete decisions, not the one that only raises slogans. Admissions for 18 new courses begin.description: RANCHI: Within a week of its academic council decision, Dr Shyama Prasad Mukherjee University (SPMU) has now opened admissions to 18 different new degree and diploma courses at the UG and PG levels at the varsity. For the new courses like rural development, tribal arts and communication, DSPMU will be pooling in faculty from various departments and inviting guest faculties for the job initially, said officials. The deadline for application for the new courses is June 17 through the university website. Talking to TOI, SN Munda, vice-chancellor of DSPMU, said, "Most of the courses are under the aegis of the parent departments of anthropology, political science and MCA. We will be engaging faculty members from these departments for teaching students as a large chunk of the syllabus in these courses are similar to the existing courses. We are rolling out 18 new courses from the 2019-20 session." This will be the second session for the institution as an independent university. SPMU was known as Ranchi College until two years ago before it was separated from Ranchi University. SPMU will also be starting classes under the School of Journalism and Mass Communication (SJMC) - with six different courses from this session. These include a six-month certificate course, a one-year diploma course along with two different bachelor degrees-one in journalism and mass communication and another on film-making. The intake for all the six courses, including PG degree and PhD course under the SJMC is 50 students each. "The admission to a few courses has already been announced. They include 10 different certificate courses in office automation, web designing, multimedia development and information security and cyber law among others," said Rajesh Singh, PRO, SPMU. Yoga Day.description: The world marks the fifth edition of International Day of Yoga on June 21, 2019. Prime Minister Narendra Modi hosted the main event in Ranchi and performed yoga along with 18,000 people. It was on September 27, 2014 that PM Modi proposed a dedicated day for Yoga to the United Nations General Assembly (UNGA). In 2015, the first International Day of Yoga was observed. Here's a look at different yoga styles and its growing popularity worldwide. Download The Times of India News App for Latest India News.

Man tries to kidnap girlfriend, fires at.description: RANCHI: A man fired and injured a relative of a girl while trying to kidnap her in Girja Kocha locality of Namkum police station area here. Police said Dilip Surin was shot in the stomach by Surindra Oraon alias Aryan around 9.30pm on Thursday. Surin was injured critically and is now undergoing treatment in Rajendra Institute of Medical Science (Rims). Police further said Oraon, a resident of Bishnupur area in Gumla district, is having a relationship with the girl who also hails from his locality. She was putting up at the house of Surin, who is her relative. Oraon arrived at the house on a motorcycle and hid a gun behind a nearby hut. He then tried to call out the girl but Surin and the girl’s maternal uncle Pravin Aind came out and tried to prevent him. Aind told police that Oraon and Surin had an argument after which the former ran behind the hut. “He then shot at Surin and fled after scaling a wall. He also fired one more round in the air before fleeing,” Aind said. A police team from different police stations rushed to the spot soon after the incident and carried out the preliminary investigations. “The accused is still absconding. Police have seized his motorcycle and teams have been sent to different places to hunt him down,” SP (rural) Ashutosh Shekhar said. Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

Bike-borne Maoists gun down 5 cops in Jh.description: JAMSHEDPUR/RANCHI: Just about 60km from Jamshedpur, Maoists on Friday gunned down five policemen at a weekly market in Seraikela-Kharsawan district in Jharkhand. The attack was the latest in a string of strikes by CPI (Maoist) in the state after the Lok Sabha polls. The incident occurred in Kukru Haat under Tiruldih police station limits. The policemen — all from Jharkhand Police — were killed on the spot. Eyewitnesses told police that the motorcycle-borne attackers fled with the weapons of the deceased. The identities of the dead policemen could not be ascertained till late evening, but sources in Ranchi said they were posted at Tiruldih police station —two were assistant sub-inspectors and three, constables. The five policemen were on patrol duty in the market on Friday. Locals said at least six Maoists, travelling on two motorcycles, first attacked the police with knives and then fired indiscriminately. “They circled the jeep and dragged the jawans out and killed them,” said a source. “One of our men, who was part of the patrolling party, is missing,” Seraikela-Kharsawan SP Chandan Sinha said. \nMajlish, a cultural association, celeb.description: Majlish, a cultural association in Ranchi, celebrated Mahalaya as Sarad Arghya at MECON community hall in Shyamali. The members celebrated the beginning of Navratri by singing traditional Durga Puja songs like Jaya Jaya Japa Japa. However, it was an enticing performance on Mahishasur Mardini, by child artistes, directed by Kajal Bose from Asansol, which drew a huge applause from the audience. Later, Majlish also staged a play titled Babuder Dalkukure, a satire on the prevailing political scenario in the country and how it is affecting the households of netas. The play, directed by thespian Nimu Bhowmik from Kolkata, had everyone in splits with its twists and excellent performance by the actors. Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

Ranchi: Daylong bandh to protest desecra.description: RANCHI: The dawn-to-dusk Ranchi bandh called by opposition parties and tribal outfits on Saturday to protest against the desecration of tribal icon Birsa Munda's statue at Kokar on Friday evoked lukewarm response as business and life in the capital went on as usual amid heavy security arrangements. Contrary to the apprehensions, commuters faced no problems as both private and public vehicles plied normally. A few schools and institutions that remained open also functioned normally. All petrol pumps too stayed opened. In the morning, Jharkhand Mukti Morcha (JMM) workers along with members of Kendriya Sarna Samiti and other tribal outfits took out a peaceful procession at Albert Ekka chowk. Members of Left parties too staged a protest at the same venue. They were arrested and sent to camp jail in Morhabadi thereafter. SSP Anish Gupta said the bandh passed off peacefully. "A total of 168 people were arrested and the protests were peaceful. We had written to all leaders to refrain from any kind of violence and warned them of strict action as per Section 120B (criminal conspiracy) of Indian penal code," he said. Amar Kumar who runs a book shop on Pustak Path near Shaheed Chowk, said: "I was a bit hesitant to open my shop in the morning. However, before noon I saw that protests were peaceful and there was no threat to property and I decided to open my shop." Meanwhile, Ranchi Municipal Corporation (RMC) repaired the statue on priority basis late on Friday night. Deputy mayor Sanjeev Vijayavargiya, who arranged the logistics for the repairs, said, "The material required to repair the statue was brought from Kolkata to Jamshedpur on train. From there we brought it to Ranchi by road on priority basis. The sculptor who had installed the statue was also called in and the statue was fixed by midnight." Tribal leaders however weren't happy with the repair work. Speaking to TOI, chief priest of Kendriya Sarna Samiti, Jaglal Pahan, said: "The desecration of Bhagwan Birsa Munda's statue is a direct attack on tribal identity and we demand a metal statue in place of brick and mortar one from the government at the same place. We have also given a asked Lalpur police to identify the people involved in the incident and bring them to justice." Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

Field officers must be sensitive towards.description: RANCHI: Newly appointed director general of police (DGP) Kamal Nayan Choubey, who assumed charge on Saturday, said that one of his top priorities is to transform the state police into more "sensitive and humane force". He also warned field officers of stringent action if they are found to be "indifferent" towards the problems of the people. He said that the mindset of police at district and the police station levels should be more public-friendly. The steps taken to close the gap between police and the public would be an important aspect of assessing the performance of SP's and the officers-in-charge of police stations. "Instead of fearing to visit the police station in emergency, people should regard the state force as friend and a help. Police should register FIR on compliant even if the issue may be small. I will take entire responsibility for sharp rise in cases in such circumstances. The police must be sensitive towards women-related issues who form 50 percent of the population," he said. The DGP added, "Reducing Left Wing Extremism (LWE), controlling cyber crime and ensuring law and order, which directly affects the common man, would be stressed upon. I would not sell dreams. However, I give assurance to work hard and with dedication to achieve constructive goals." He stated the current government policies towards LWE have yielded positive results and they would be continued with more vigour. He said, "Extremists who are disenchanted by functioning of their organisation are welcome to surrender under state government's policy. The police would, however, verify whether the person is genuinely an ultra or a pretender laying down arms before police merely to take benefits of government schemes." He opined that ensuring an eco-system for development, which would also attract the people towards the social mainstream, is another important way to reduce extremism. "Police would play important role in creating environment for implementation of welfare projects," he said. On cyber crime, he observed it was a challenging issue with a few districts becoming ill-famed across the country for such activities. "State police would train its personnel to deal with this crime and if needed resource persons would be roped in from outside the state to handle the situation. We have to remain a step ahead of cyber criminals and LWE situation in state," he stated. The DGP also held meeting with top police officers after assuming office and told them that he would manage the police force through collective leadership and team spirit. He said a meeting would be held with field officers within a fortnight in which lists of criminals, extremists and pending cases and steps taken to handle them would be discussed. BJP Candidate List.description: NEW DELHI: Amid rumblings over ticket denials in some seats like Kanpur, where saffron veteran   Murli Manohar Joshi has been benched   , and Bangalore South, where the wife of late party leader Ananth Kumar was overlooked for a young debutant, BJP issued on Tuesday a list of 43 nominees for the Lok Sabha polls. Not budging in the face of Joshi’s stiff resistance to being asked to step aside, BJP announced Satyadev Pachauri, a minister in the UP cabinet, as the replacement for the octogenarian leader. The list of 30 candidates for UP, however, accommodated women and child welfare minister Maneka Gandhi and her son Varun Gandhi, who were allowed to swap their Pilibhit and Sultanpur seats. Other interesting picks include   actor-politician Jaya Prada   , who was named against SP leader Azam Khan from Rampur in UP soon after she joined BJP. The selection ignites an old and bitter rivalry, as the former Bollywood star is close to former SP leader Amar Singh who has scores to settle with SP and Khan. Another UP cabinet minister, Rita Bahuguna Joshi, a former UP Congress chief who joined BJP, will contest from the prestigious constituency of Allahabad, where the sitting party MP, Shyama Charab Gupta, has left for SP and is contesting from Banda. She is the daughter of the late H N Bahuguna, a former UP chief minister and well-known Congress leader. Law minister Ravi Shankar Prasad, the party’s candidate from Patna Sahib, faced protests when he landed in Patna on Tuesday. The protesters claimed loyalty to BJP’s Rajya Sabha MP R K Sinha, who was later pulled up by the party while sources said the heckling was led by a person identified as an expelled BJP member. Varun Gandhi, who has had his ups and downs in BJP, was on the list of nominees and will stake his claim for Pilibhit, which has been a family bastion. Maneka Gandhi will be pitted in a triangular contest against SP-BSP alliance candidate Chandrabhanu Singh, alias Sonu Singh, a local politician with clout among Rajput voters who could have turned up the heat for Varun. Rajya Sabha MP Sanjay Singh is in the fray as the Congress nominee. Joshi, a former BJP president, made no secret of his displeasure at being denied a ticket and went public by releasing a letter addressed to voters of Kanpur saying he received a call from party general secretary (organisation) Ramlal asking him not to contest the polls. Joshi, 85, has been asked not to contest just as it was decided that 91-year-old party patriarch L K Advani will not fight from Gandhinagar. Joshi’s defiant note was possibly the reason behind the nomination of a Brahmin face as another UP state minister, Satish Mahana, had been talked of as the frontrunner to replace the veteran leader The party decision is in line with several veterans not being nominated to pave way for younger leaders. The 2019 election will see the curtain drop on the electoral politics of what was seen the Vajpayee-Advani era in the party. BJP has also not given tickets to B C Khanduri, Karia Munda, Kalraj Mishra, Bijoya Chakravarty — all MPs for several terms and over 80 years of age. BJP sprang a surprise by giving 28-year-old Tejaswi Surya, an advocate and Karnataka Bharatiya Janata Yuva Morcha general secretary, the ticket from Bangalore South, belying expectations that Tejaswini Ananth Kumar would be its choice for the constituency her husband represented six times. The choice triggered strong protests and even state BJP president B S Yeddyurappa said they had sent only Tejaswini’s name, which, he claimed, was changed in Delhi. Tejaswini had to issue statements to mollify her supporters as she said the polls were about re-electing Narendra Modi as Prime Minister. BJP has announced 349 candidates, including 62 in UP, so far. Two seats in UP have been left for alliance partner Apna Dal (Sonelal). Party president Amit Shah will decide the remaining 16 seats in UP where sitting MPs are likely to be replaced, and a reason behind delaying the announcement is to reduce prospects of dissidence and rebellion. The party has so far dropped 14 sitting MPs in UP. BJP general secretary Arun Singh announced that Union minister Manoj Sinha has been fielded from Ghazipur, a seat he had won in 2014. BJP’s Kisan Morcha chief Birendra Singh Mast has been shifted from his sitting seat Bhadohi to far-east Ballia in UP, replacing sitting MP Bharat Singh, whose poor performance was a concern for the party. Agra MP Ram Shankar Katheria, head of the SC commission who had been denied renomination from the current seat, has been moved to Etawah (SC), replacing Ashok Kumar Dohray. UP BJP president Mahendra Nath Pandey has been repeated from Chandauli. In Video:No Murli Manohar Joshi in BJP list of 43Download The Times of India News App for Latest Elections News.

Congress wants to field Jharkhand chief.description: In a meeting chaired by East Singhbhum district Congress committee chief Vijay Khan at Tilak Pustakalaya in Bistupur, Jamshedpur, a decision was taken that if mahagathbandhan parties fight the forthcoming Jharkhand assembly polls together, the Grand Old Party would field its candidate in Jamshedpur East, Jamshedpur West and Potka (reserved) assembly seat. Sources also said Ajoy Kumar could be fielded from the Jamshedpur West seat. A section of district Congress functionaries feels that if Ajoy refuses to contest from the seat, a leader from the minority community should be the Congress nominee. District Congress president Vijay Khan talking to TOI on Monday confirmed that a section of functionaries from the party’s Jamshedpur West segment wants Ajoy to contest from the seat. Jamshedpur West seat has a sizeable Muslim population. It may be mentioned here that Jamshedpur Lok Sabha has six assembly segments — Jamshedpur West, Jamshedpur East, Jugsalai, Potka, Ghatshila and Baharagora. Sources said district Congress also decided that if there is no tie-up, Congress would contest on all seats. Interestingly, the former state minister and former Jamshedpur West MLA from Congress, Banna Gupta, a known face in the party, was absent from the meeting. Absence of Gupta led to a lot of speculation, as after the party’s recent Lok Sabha poll debacle Gupta had questioned the leadership of state Congress head Ajoy Kumar. After this, district president Khan had sought disciplinary action against Gupta for questioning the leadership of Kumar in public. At the meeting, discussions were held on how to improve Congress’s tally in the coming polls due at the end of the year. Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

\nBBA students of BIT-Mesra\u2019s Lalpu.description: The BBA students of BIT-Mesra’s Lalpur extension recently threw a Fresher’s Day party at a hotel to welcome the new batch of students. To break the ice, the seniors arranged various games like musical chairs, balloon dance and a fashion show. Needless to say, the freshers' had a gala time. On the dance floor Once the events got over, everyone trooped on to the dance floor, shimmying on the beats of latest chartbusters like Brown rang, Cocktail mashup and Disco deewane. Rajat’s moves on the song Angreji beat impressed everybody while Namrata and Sandhya matched steps to Chinta ta ta.Silence please Amidst all the revelry, the entry of Speaker CP Singh as the chief guest made everyone fall in line. Nonetheless, the students enjoyed the event to the hilt. Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

Lok Sabha Elections in Tamil Nadu.description: NEW DELHI: Tamil Nadu goes to polls in the second phase of the seven-phase elections. Elections to 39 parliamentary seats will take place on April 18 in a single-phase polling. Lok Sabha elections 2019: Get all live updatesTOP CONTENDERSThe four-cornered contest features AIADMK-led National Democratic Alliance (NDA), its chief rival DMK-led Secular Progressive Alliance (SPA), actor Kamal Haasan's Makkal Needhi Maiam and TTV Dhinakaran's Amma Makkal Munnetra Kazhagam (AMMK). This time the elections are taking place sans the Dravidian stalwarts M Karunanidhi and J Jayalalithaa. AIADMK chief Jayalalithaa passed away in December 2016 while Karunanidhi died in August 2018. While the DMK is contesting on 20 seats, the Congress is fighting elections on 9 seats in Tamil Nadu. In the AIADMK-BJP alliance, the national party will be contesting from five seats in the state while the PMK will be contesting from seven. Tamil Nadu Lok Sabha elections: Get all live updatesHOW MANY SEATS?Tamil Nadu has 39 Lok Sabha seats and one in neighbouring Puducherry. Here is the list of constituencies: Arakkonam, Arani, Chennai Central, Chennai North, Chennai South, Chidambaram(SC), Coimbatore, Cuddalore, Dharmapuri, Dindigul, Erode, Kallakurichi, Kancheepuram(SC), Kanyakumari, Karur, Krishnagiri, Madurai, Mayiladuthurai, Nagapattinam(SC), Namakkal Nilgiris(SC), Perambalur, Pollachi, Ramanathapuram, Salem, Sivaganga, Sriperumbudur, Tenkasi(SC), Thanjavur, Theni, Thiruvallur(SC), Thoothukudi, Tiruchirapalli, Tirunelveli, Tiruppur, Tiruvannamalai, Vellore, Villupuram(SC), Virudhunagar, Puducherry(Union Territory) KEY CONSTITUENCIESThe key constutuencies include Sivaganga, Chennai South, Chennai North, Chennai Central, Chidambaram(SC), Coimbatore, Cuddalore, Dharmapuri, Dindigul, Kanyakumari, Karur, Thoothukudi , Nilgiris(SC), Trichy, Vellore amd Arani. \u2018BJP to redouble efforts to get 65-.description: With an aim to continue the development work in Jharkhand, BJP aims to increase its tally to 65+ in the forthcoming assembly election, likely to be held at the end of the year. Party president Amit Shah held a two-day meeting of party in-charges of Jharkhand, Haryana and Maharashtra on June 13 and 14. During the meeting, Shah set a target for BJP to win 65 seats own its own in the 81-member Jharkhand assembly. BJP heads the NDA government in Jharkhand with Ajsu-P as its partner. State BJP president Laxman Gilua told TOI, “To speed up the development work, both the state and the Centre have to work hand in hand.” He said the need of the hour is the “double engine” government — same party rule both at the Centre and the state — so that there are no speed breakers on the road to development. Highlighting the achievements of the current NDA government-led by Raghubar Das in the state, Gilua said all-round development of the state in the next five years will be possible as there will be the “double engine” government, too. Recounting his recent meeting in Delhi with Shah, Gilua said all efforts would be made to get 65+ seats. He said similar measures taken up during the the Lok Sabha polls, like making every party functionary play an active role in the polls, would be replicated for the state polls. He added booth-level committees would be strengthened so that party can improve its tally in every booth. The meeting with Shah was attended by Jamshedpur MP Bidyut Baran Mahato, state poll in-charge Mangal Pandey and several party big wigs apart from Gilua. In the recent polls, BJP won 12 out of 14 Lok Sabha seats in state and vote share indicated that party is ahead in 63 assembly seats. In the 2014 state polls, BJP and its ally Ajsu-P bagged 42 seats, just one more than simple majority in the House. Giula said going ahead with this calculation, BJP wants to improve its tally to 65 plus seats. On alliances with other parties, Gilua said Ajsu-P is already an ally and the tie-up would continue. Commenting on JD(U), Gilua said, “We are partners in Bihar and at the Centre.” He indicated the possibility of joining hands for the state polls with the Nitish Kumar-led party. Gilua, however, refused to comment if BJP would fight the state polls with Raghubar Das as chief ministerial face. He said each and every person in the party is equally important so a chief ministerial candidate is not an issue. Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

Police on alert after SUV mows down one.description: RANCHI: A day after a speeding SUV mowed down one person and injured three others near Booty More under Bariyatu police station here, city police on Wednesday kept a close vigil on rumours doing the rounds of social media. A few locals had intercepted the vehicle after the accident and set it on fire. Although the rogue driver was immediately arrested on Tuesday night, police said that distorted versions of the incident having the potential to create unrest were being circulated on social media on Wednesday morning. Ranchi SSP Anish Gupta said they have alerted cyber cell to track the developments and have issued an advisory to the public to tackle falsehood. The injured persons are undergoing treatment in a hospital. Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

'Hunger death' victim's body to be exhum.description: DALTONGANJ: A senior Jharkhand minister on Saturday said the body of an elderly Adivasi, who allegedly died of hunger three days ago, would be exhumed to find out the actual reasons of his death. The dead tribal was identified as Ramchandra Munda (65) from Lurgumi Kalan Tola at Durup village of Latehar district. Quoting Munda's daughter, Sonali Kumari, Right to Food activist Asarfi Nand Prasad on Saturday said, "Munda didn't have anything to eat for three days before he died. The last meal had taken was boiled rice and starch." On Friday, deputy commissioner (Latehar) Rajiv Kumar indicated that Munda had not been getting his ration through the PDS for at least two months. He said, "When we went through the delivery records, the columns next to Munda's name was empty of the last two months. We have to find out if the ration meant for him was sold to someone else by the PDS dealer." Faced with growing criticism of the government for Munda's death and Kumar's subsequent observations, food, civil supplies & consumer affair minister Saryu Rai, while on a visit to Latehar on Saturday, took exception to the way the deputy commissioner handled the case. Rai said, "There were many lapses in the way the district administration handled the case. It was highly inept." He added that he would send two senior officials to investigate Munda's death. The minister further said, "Munda's body should have been exhumed for post mortem and the entire procedure videographed. But these things were done." \nMerrymaking during the Navratri celebr.description: As the daylights gave way to the arclights, the lush lawns of a city hotel came alive with merrymaking crowd, celebrating Navratra on the dandiya beats. The participants were seen enjoying the evening with elan, twirling to one song after another amid cheers from the friends and family. “Dandiya is big in in Ranchi. Last time I had missed it but this time, I wanted to make sure I had a taste of it this season,” said Darshana, who was seen enjoying with her gang of friends. The already excited festive crowd became almost unmanageable with the entry of the Kaliyon ka chaman girl, Meghna Naidu, who made revellers swoon with her moves to Ooh la la and Munni badnam. The other star attraction, Sambhavna Seth was energy personified once she took to the stage, shimming to the beats of Chammak chhallo and Chinta ta ta. Though it was meant to be a traditional night, very few actually bothered to get into the traditional Dandiya costume and instead came dressed in their normal fare. Civil surgeon files FIR against three Ha.description: HAZARIBAG: Civil surgeon of Hazaribag district, Dr Lalita Verma, on Tuesday filed FIRs against three private clinics for violating Clinical Establishment Act. The FIRs were filed after the intervention of district commissioner Ravi Shankar Shukla. Verma said FIRs will also filed against two more ultrasonography (USG) clincs which were sealed recently by DDC Vijaya Jadhav during a raid. Earlier on May 30, Jadhav led a team to raid the clinics and two of them - Sahara USG Clinic and Dr Jeetendra Singh's USG - and three private nursing homes - Poonam Nursing Home and hospital, Jeevandeep Nursing Home and Sahay Nursing Home - in town area were found operating in violation of the Clinical Establishment Act. Later, they were sealed. Shukla said, "Prima facie findings have revealed that all three nursing homes violated the Clinical Establishment Act which necessitated their sealing and an FIR to send a strong message." He added, "As far as the UGS clinics are concerned, we have sought details of slips issued by the clinics for conducting USG of expecting mothers. After studying those, FIR will be slapped, if we see any discrepancy." After the DDC conducted the raid, the civil surgeon had termed it illegal saying no consent was taken from her office. The DC, however, justified the raids and directed the civil surgeon to file the FIRs. The DC also said he has also sought an explanation from the civil surgeon for her "irresponsible" statements, questioning the veracity of the raids. SSB jawan killed in encounter with Maois.description: DUMKA: A jawan was killed and four others were injured in an encounter between the Sashastra Seema Bal (SSB) and Maoists in forests of Taldangal in Dumka district on Sunday, a senior police officer said here. Superintendent of Police, Y S Ramesh : In an encounter with Naxals in Dumka, 1 jawan has lost his life and 4 others… https://t.co/byiWN5Woin— ANI (@ANI) 1559442518000A search operation was going on when Maoists opened fire on jawans around 3.30 am, Superintendent of Police Y S Ramesh said. He said in the retaliatory action, at least five Maoists received bullets as they retreated into the forest. SSB jawan Niraj Chetri was killed while Rajesh Kumar Rai, Sonu Kumar, Satish Gujar and Karan Kumar were injured, he said. While Rai was airlifted to Ranchi for treatment, others were admitted to the Dumka Sadar Hospital, the police officer said. Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

Chandrababu Naidu.description: KURNOOL: Prime Minister Narendra Modi on Friday launched a blistering attack on Andhra Pradesh chief minister and erstwhile ally N Chandrababu Naidu, calling him 'u-turn Babu', whose "intent" was not on state's development. Addressing a well-attended election rally here, he sought to reject Naidu's repeated attacks that his government neglected the state. Andhra Pradesh goes to siumultaneous elections to the 175-member assembly and 25 Lok Sabha seats in the first phase on April 11 with the BJP contesting them alone. Listing various initiatives taken by the NDA government for Andhra Pradesh, Modi said it was during his regime that the Vizag-Chennai industrial corridor was flagged off and approval for the first National Institute of Ocean Technology (NIOT) given. It was also the 'chowkidar' who cleared the first Indian Institute of Packaging (IIP) besides approving the greenfield petrochemical complex for the state, he said. "Five years ago, your one vote made me PM. Your Pradhan sewak worked selflessly day and night for the people of the country. Chowkidar kept the interest of the state in mind," he said. Modi also recalled that the NDA government sanctioned first central university in Anantpur. He accused Naidu, the Telugu Desam Party supremo, of pasting state government 'stickers' on the Central schemes. "For sure, I could have done more work. I just required the cooperation of the state government. I made all efforts from my side, but the person who is running the government (Naidu), his intention is not Andhra Pradesh's development," Modi said. Levelling charges of corruption and dynasty politics against Naidu, he said the election date of April 11 will usher in the "double engine" of the state's growth -- a BJP government both at the Centre and the state. There was debate going on in AP that there were 'schemes for corruption,' ranging from the creation of the new capital Amravati, the Prime Minister charged. "The people of Andhra Pradhesh know whose coffers are being filled.. when this chowkidar sought accounts, u-turn Babu took a u-turn from AP's growth and walked out from NDA," Modi lashed out. Naidu had snapped ties with the NDA in March last year, accusing the Centre of not honouring the "promised" special category status to Andhra Pradesh. Hitting out at the TDP supremo for getting close to the Congress, Modi said Naidu has "found friends who are on bail," apparently referring to Congress leaders Rahul Gandhi and Sonia Gandhi who are on bail in the National Herald case. Modi, who had in the past hit out at Naidu for alleged family politics, said the election should also see the "son set", and called for a new "sun rise." He deliberately stressed on the "son" part to drive home his point on dynasty politics targeting the AP chief minister and his son and state minister Nara Lokesh. Without elaborating, Modi mocked that Pakistan has now accepted Naidu's "friends" as "hero." Download The Times of India News App for Latest Elections News.

BSP List 2019 UP.description: LUCKNOW: The BSP on Friday announced its first list of 11 candidates for the Lok Sabha elections 2019, fielding JD(S) turncoat Kunwar Danish Ali from Amroha. Ali, who was general secretary of the Janata Dal-Secular, quit the party and joined the Bahujan Samaj Party only last week. The BSP also declared Haji Fazulrahman its nominee from Saharanpur, Malook Nagar from Bijnore and Girish Chandra from Nagina, a party release said. Hazi Mohammad Yakoob has been fielded from Meerut, Satbeer Nagar from Gautam Buddh Nagar, Yogesh Verma from Bulandshahr, Ajit Baliyan from Aligarh, Manoj Kumar Soni from Agra, Rajveer Singh from Fatehpur Sikri and Ruchi Veera from Aonla. Mayawati's BSP is contesting 38 of the 80 Lok Sabha constituencies in Uttar Pradesh under the seat-sharing arrangement with Samajwadi Party and the Rashtriya Lok Dal. Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

Rahul Gandhi.description: NEW DELHI: Strongly indicating that he does not intend to review his decision to step down as Congress president after the party's Lok Sabha debacle, Rahul Gandhi on Thursday said the party would decide on his successor and he would keep himself aloof from the process. Asked by the media in the Parliament complex about his possible successor, Rahul crucially did not parry the question but answered that he was not the person to decide on the issue and that it was a task for the party. After weeks of anonymous claims, this was the first confirmation of his intent to quit as the AICC chief ever since he announced the decision at a closed-door meeting of the Congress Working Committee (CWC) on May 25. While the apex body turned down the resignation, Congress insiders said that Rahul is insistent on leaving the top job and had rebuffed all attempts to persuade him to stay on. Lok Sabha poll fallout: Congress considers naming interim presidentEven before Rahul publicly declared his intent, there were indications that Congress was considering naming a working president or interim president at the head of a "collegium" of leaders. Names of veterans like Mallikarjun Kharge, Sushilkumar Shinde, Ashok Gehlot, Mukul Wasnik and Prithviraj Chavan have done the rounds as likely candidates. Rahul's insistence that no one from the Gandhi family should hold the post effectively rules out sister Priyanka. Take charge, douse fire in Cong: Moily tells Rahul GandhiRahul's brief remark comes at a time when the party is caught in a bitter blame-game with its data department under Praveen Chakraborty in the crossfire for "misleading" the leadership on the trends in the Lok Sabha elections. The attack has been sharp with allegations that the data itself was not reliable with Chakraborty's proximity to Rahul raising the question whether the "feedback" only served to strengthen the leader's inclination to target PM Narendra Modi's image. Meanwhile, Rahul met Chhattisgarh CM Bhupesh Baghel along with AICC state in-charge P L Punia for a political discussion on Thursday evening. Party leaders attach importance to the meeting given that he has been reluctant to interact with colleagues lately. However, Rahul's public attestation about quitting may make it difficult for AICC managers to sway his thinking. As it became apparent that he might actually refuse to relent, various proposals have been mooted to make decision-making a collective affair through a "collegium" so that Rahul returns to active presidency. There have also been suggestions that a working president could be appointed. The proposal for a collegium is rooted in Rahul's complaint that he has been working alone and the party leaders did not pull their weight behind him in the LS polls. He had aired his grievances at the now-famous CWC brainstorming called after the party failed to improve its performance, going from 44 to 52. However, Congress leaders said they would continue to make efforts to persuade Rahul. Rajasthan CM Ashok Gehlot told TOI, "Rahul has to remain the Congress president. He worked hard and fearlessly. Victory and defeat are part of polls." Gehlot warned if Rahul quits, Congress workers would either become inactive or leave the party.Sources say Rahul is hell-bent on quitting and has made it clear that none from the Gandhi family should be put at the helm of the Congress organisation. In Video:Won't decide who will be the next president of Congress: Rahul GandhiDownload The Times of India News App for Latest India News.

Tamil Nadu Elections.description: Voting for Lok Sabha elections 2019 in Tamil Nadu will take place in a single phase on April 18 as per the notification issued by the Election Commission of India. The counting of votes will take place on May 23. | Lok Sabha elections 2019: Get all live updatesThe four-cornered contest for the 39 Lok Sabha seats features AIADMK-led National Democratic Alliance (NDA), its chief rival DMK-led Secular Progressive Alliance (SPA), actor Kamal Haasan's Makkal Needhi Maiam and TTV Dhinakaran's Amma Makkal Munnetra Kazhagam (AMMK). Out of the 39 seats in the state, seven Lok Sabha seats are reserved for SC. The constituencies reserved for SC candidates are Thiruvallur, Kancheepuram, Villupuram, Nilgiris, Chidambaram, Nagapattinam and Tenkasi in Tamil Nadu. | Tamil Nadu Lok Sabha elections: Get all live updatesIn the last Lok Sabha polls, AIADMK had a vote share of 44.3 per cent by winning 37 seats. BJP had a vote share of 5.5 per cent by winning just 1 seat, while NDA managed to win two seats with a vote share of 18.5 per cent PMK won one seat and had a vote share of 4.4 per cent. BJP (NDA) had an alliance with PMK. DMK was not able to win on any seat in the last Lok Sabha polls. In Lok Sabha elections 2019, DMK is contesting on 20 seats, while the Congress is fighting elections on 9 seats in Tamil Nadu. In the AIADMK-BJP alliance, the national party will be contesting from five seats in the state while the PMK will be contesting from seven. More fatal accidents on NHs: Report.description: RANCHI: With fatalities in road accidents reported across the state almost every day in the past few weeks, a look at the latest data available with the Union ministry of road transport and highways indicated that accidents on National Highways (NH) in the state have killed more people than on the state highways. Between 2014 and 2017, at least 4,466 lives were lost in NH accidents across Jharkhand, while the number of road accident-related fatalities in the same period across state highways is 3,510. The number of total accidents in the state every year close to about 5,000 during the last four-year period and the highest number of deaths occurred in 2017 with 3,256 casualties out of a total of 3,034 fatal accidents in the state during the year. In 2018, the number of deaths saw a marginal drop of 4.7% with the number reducing to 3,104 deaths. Even though the number of accidents between 2014 and 2017 have not increased, the total fatalities have spiked from 2,628 in 2014 to 3,256 in 2017. The number of deaths in accidents on National Highways have also seen a steep increase from 669 in 2014 to almost double in 2017 at 1,250. According to a district transport department official, a total of 654 road accidents took place in which 300 people died in 2018 in Ranchi. Out of all the total number of victims, over 300 sustained grievous injures. In 2019, though the data is yet to be tabulated, but the official said on an average, anywhere between 45-50 accidents are being reported every month in which the casualty rate is 50%. Outlining the reason for the high fatality, city-based road safety activist Rishab Anand said, “There are two factors that make accidents on the National Highway more fatal than the state highways. One is the common notion that NH is built for speeding and that results in fatal accidents. Second is the comparatively lower accessibility to medical facilities in the crucial hours following the accident on the highway which also ends up costing much more lives.” The issue has already come as a concern for the state government with chief secretary D K Tiwari recently instructing the departments concerned for deployment of ambulances equipped with GPS and other connectivity tools with the nearest police station for every 50 km on national highways across the state. “The goal is to cut down on the number of road accidents in the state in half by 2020. More highway patrolling and effective use of cameras to crack down on rash drivers is equally crucial,” Tiwari said, stressing on the extra effort made on the 146 “black” spots identified on the state and National Highways in the state. JD (U) likely to go it alone in Jharkhan.description: PATNA: Speculations are rife that chief minister Nitish Kumar-led JD (U) may contest the coming state assembly polls in Jharkhand on its own. Jharkhand JD (U) chief Salkhan Murmu said on Thursday that he would submit a proposal to Nitish the proposed meeting of the national executive committee to be held in Patna on June 9. “My proposal is based on logic and not merely on expectations,” he said. Murmu said the JD (U), which is part of the ruling NDA in Bihar and also at the Centre, has already started preparations for the assembly election in Jharkhand and meetings of party workers are being held at divisional and district levels at regular intervals. “We are getting feedback from our workers at the grass roots level. But the national president will take a final call on the matter whether to go solo or with alliance partner,” Murmu told this newspaper over phone. He, however, said the party is gearing up to contest all the 81 seats, if the situation arises so. The recent development at the centre when the party was offered only one symbolic ministerial berth in PM Narendra Modi-cabinet has compelled the leadership of the party to be ready for similar situation in Jharkhand. He said the JD (U) may provide an alternative to the tribals, who are no more inclined to the main opposition JMM-Congress combine. “The disenchantment of the tribals towards JMM-Congress combine can be gauged from the fact that JMM chief Sibu Soren lost the recently concluded Lok Sabha election. The JMM, which claimed to have championed the cause of the tribals, ruled over the state for three terms. But what did the tribals get from the JMM led government? They feel deceived by all parties,” the Jharkhand chief said. He said even the BJP has failed to garner the support of the tribals as desired. The BJP won the two tribal (reserved) Lok Sabha seats—Khunti and Lohardagga—with a thin margin. Besides, out of the 14, the BJP-AJSU combine bagged 11 and one seat respectively. The issues of tribal locals and non-tribal locals will also dominate the electoral scene, which will go in favour of the party, he added. Above all, the JD (U) will project Nitish Kumar’s development model for the people of Jharkhand as well. “Both the JMM-Congress and the BJP have ruled the state ever since it came into existence. But they have not come up to the expectations of the majority of the people. Moreover, people belonging to minority community will prefer the JD (U) instead of other parties because of its clear stand on secularism,” the state president added. Meanwhile, JD (U) secretary general KC Tyagi said the party would submit a proposal to Arunachal Pradesh (AP) speaker for staking claim on the portfolio of Leader of Opposition in the AP legislative assembly, where BJP is in majority. He said though the JD (U) will support the BJP government but it is the rightful claimant for having its leader of Opposition as it has seven MLA, the second largest chunk in the 60- member assembly in Arunachal Pradesh. Tyagi, however, added that if Pema Khandu-led BJP government in AP will extend proposal for induction of JD (U) MLAs in his cabinet of minister, then JD (U) will readily accept it. “If the BJP government in AP sends invitation to us, then we would have no issues in becoming a part of the government. Our main motto is to keep the NDA strong,” he said. BJP and JD (U) contested the assembly elections in AP separately held on April 11. While BJP won 41 seats and formed the government, JD (U) with winning seven out of 15 seats it contested, became the second largest party. Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

\nAmazing performances by a dance troupe.description: The opening of a new bar at a city hotel recently saw the guests having a gala time. Dressed in their casual best, the guests, for once, let their guard down, and enjoyed the evening over drinks and some amazing performances by a dance troupe from Kolkata. However, it was G Kumarsan’s act on the dance floor which drew the maximum cheers. Mantu’s Bhangra skills on Dhol Jageero Da was also applauded. The eves, especially Sarita, Rashmi and Ranjani were seen sharing their plans for the festive season. Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

Satta King 2019.description: NEW DELHI: Satta Matka is a form of gambling or lottery that had originated before the Independence of India.Originally, the game of Matka gambling involved betting on the opening and closing rates of cotton as transmitted to the Bombay Cotton Exchange from the New York Cotton Exchange, via teleprinters.The modern-day Matka gambling/ Satta King is based on random number selection and betting. The players participating in the Satta Matka game/ gambling are required to choose the right number for winning the game. The player who wins the game becomes Satta King and is rewarded financially. Two of the most famous Matka games are - Kalyan and Worli. The Kalyan Matka gambling was started by Kalyanji Bhagat, a farmer from Gujarat, in 1962 and it ran for all days of the week. Another Matka gambling, New Worli Matka, was started by the Rattan Khatri in 1964 with slight modifications to the rules of the game. Khatri’s Matka ran only five days a week, from Monday to Friday.The modern Matka business is centred around Maharashtra.Some of the terms used in the game and their meaning is given below:    Term Meaning   Matka Matka means earthen pot that were used to draw numbers   Single Any digit between 0 and 9   Jodi/Pair Any pair of two digits between 00 and 99    Patti/Panna Three digit number    Open result / close result Outcome of matka betting   Berij Berij is last digit of jodi's/pair's sum The Google 2018 trends data shows that 'satta' and 'matka' were the top searched words in the Madhya Pradesh state in the year 2018. As per the Google data, 'satta' was the 4th most searched word with a score of 36 and 'matka' came 6th with a score of 23.Any form of Satta Matka gambling is illegal in India.Disclaimer: This content is for reference purpose only and The Times of India claims no ownership of this content. The Times of India does not support or promote piracy in any manner.Download The Times of India News App for Latest India News.

'Jharkhand infant mortality rate fifth-l.description: RANCHI: Jharkhand's infant mortality rate (IMR) has improved but the state still has a lot of ground to cover, a recent survey conducted by the office of the Registrar General of India revealed. The Sample Registration Survey (SRS) of 2017, whose findings were released late last month, has put Jharkhand's IMR at 29 deaths per 1,000 live births. The SRS bulletin - which is the latest survey of India's health indicators on birth rate, death rate, natural growth rate and IMR - has shown a better performance of Jharkhand in comparison to 2015-16, when 44 out of every 1,000 newborns had died. The latest study has shown a heavy drop in IMR in rural areas of the state. In 2017, as many as 30 of 1,000 infants had died in rural areas while in 2015-16, the death rate was 46 deaths per 1,000 live births. In 2017, IMR at urban areas was at 24 deaths per 1,000 live births. The state has been jointly ranked fifth among 21 states with Telangana. While Kerala has the lowest IMR at 10, Madhya Pradesh has the highest at 47 per live births. Jharkhand's IMR is also better than the national average, which stands at 33 deaths per 1,000 live births. Nitin Madan Kulkarni, state health secretary, attributed the performance to a host of measures being undertaken. "Over the last few years, ante-natal care is being provided to as many as 80% of pregnant women. Institutional delivery has risen and the distribution system of iron folic acid (IFA) tablets to pregnant mothers have been strengthened. Ambulance services, rolled out for ferrying pregnant women for institutional delivery, has also helped in reduction of IMR," Kulkarni said. Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

Ajsu-P's Jugsalai MLA to get cabinet ber.description: RANCHI: BJP's ally Ajsu-P on Wednesday announced that its Jugsalai MLA Ramchandra Sahis will replace former Ramgarh MLA Chandra Prakash Choudhary in the state cabinet. The ministerial berth fell vacant after Choudhary won the Giridh Lok Sabha seat in the recently-concluded parliamentary polls. Sahis will take oath on Thursday evening. Ajsu-P central spokesperson Deosharan Bhagat said, "His name was finalised after a couple of rounds of meeting within the party earlier this week. We kept several aspects in mind to maintain a balance within the party and in the government." The party had short-listed two sitting MLAs - Raj Kishore Mahto (Tundi) and Sahis. Initially, Mahto was in the fray after many within the party backed him because he is a popular kurmi face - a significant vote base for Ajsu-P. Sources within Ajsu-P said the Sudesh Mahto-led party is focussing on reviving its image ahead of the assembly polls, and not restrict itself to be known as a party dominated by Mahtos. The assembly elections will also be an acid test for Ajsu-P for more than one reasons because of its poor show in bypolls since 2014. "In the lone LS seat which we fought, we named a Mahto. If we had recommended Raj Kishore Mahto for the ministerial berth at this juncture, it would have led credence to the perception. Therefore, we decided to appoint Sahis, who is from Scheduled Castes community," said a party insider. Talking to TOI, Sahis said that he will use the opportunity to the fullest. "I will barely be a minister for four or five months so there is not much that I could do, but I will try to maintain the momentum of development in whichever department I am entrusted with," he said. The BJP and Ajsu Party had jointly fought the 2014 assembly election. Ajsu-P had won five seats. But a year later its strength came down to four after Lohardaga MLA K K Bhagat's membership was terminated owing to his conviction in a murder case. Subsequently, its Tamar MLA Vikas Kumar Munda left the party following differences with Mahto. Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

Pawan Kalyan.description: GUNTUR: Stating that they will bulldoze bastions of TDP and YSR Congress, Janasena president Pawan Kalyan promised to grant Rs 5,000 pension to all farmers in the state. He said they will also grant Rs 8,000 crop incentive to farmers soon after coming into power in the next elections. Pawan further said his government would provide six to 10 LPG cylinders free-of-cost to each family every year. and also promised to fill 3 lakh vacancies in the government departments to provide jobs to youth. Addressing a meeting in Guntur on Monday, Pawan said that the future of the state did not mean the future of Lokesh and Jagan but it was the future of the people. “The space on the state’s political stage is not TDP’s and YSRC’s property as youth and women are eager to bring change through Jana Sena.” “TDP had lost moral right to rule the state as chief minister N Chandrababu Naidu had no control over his legislators who indulged in illegal activities,” Pawan said adding that he jumped into the political arena to bring in a change in the lives of commoners. “We supported TDP and BJP in the last elections with a hope to transform the state. Unfortunately, both of them have shattered our dreams,” he said. “Guntur city has been left in a lurch despite located a few kilometres away from the capital city. The entire city has been dug out in the guise of laying underground drainage scheme and left without repair. How shocking it is to see 30 people dying of diarrhoea in a city like Guntur? Is it not the failure of the state government? Opposition leader Jaganmohan Reddy is equally responsible for the tragedy as he never dared to question the government by going to the assembly,” he said. He further said they would construct apartments exclusively for Muslims in the city. He appealed to people to support his candidates Chandrasekhar (Guntur West), Zia-Ur-Rehman (East) and MP candidate Bonaboina Srinivas Yadav in the elections, Pawan said they fielded a BC candidate Srinivasa Yadav whereas TDP and YSRC both have given tickets to their own communities.
